stem: The unit manager is reviewing four complex cases currently on the floor. Based on the documentation in the Barrier to Discharge Log, match each barrier with the most appropriate interdisciplinary professional to resolve the issue.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Patient A: Client is homeless and has no local address to receive home oxygen delivery. 
Patient B: Client is medically stable for discharge but the family disagrees on whether he should go home or to a nursing facility. No Power of Attorney (POA) is on file. 
Patient C: Client requires a specialized bariatric bed and hoyer lift at home, but his insurance has denied the initial request. 
Patient D: Client is a non-English speaker and refuses a life-saving blood transfusion due to religious beliefs.

tabs.title: Barrier to Discharge Log
tabs.content:
PatientPrimary BarrierStatus
AHousing instability / No fixed addressUnresolved
BFamily conflict regarding placement / Legal statusUnresolved
CInsurance denial for Durable Medical Equipment (DME)Unresolved
DCultural/Religious conflict with therapyUnresolved

tabs.title: Available Services
tabs.content:
Social Work: Community resources, housing, and financial aid. 
Case Management: Insurance liaison, DME coordination, and utilization review. 
Ethics Committee: Complex values conflicts and end-of-life disagreements. 
Interpreter Services: Language bridge and cultural mediation.

rows.text: Homelessness and lack of community resources
Insurance denial and negotiation for medical equipment
Language barriers and religious refusal of treatment

rationale.correct: Social Work (r1) handles environmental and social issues like homelessness (c1). Case Management (r2) focuses on the financial/logistical interface with insurance and DME (c2). The Ethics Committee (r3) is for resolving deep value conflicts or legal-decision making impasses (c3). Interpreters and Chaplains (r4) manage the cultural/religious bridge for treatment refusal (c4).
clinicalPearls: Ethics Committee = When the team and family can't agree on 'what is right'.

questionTrap.trap: Referring a homeless patient to Case Management.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the problem is 'Where will they sleep?', it is always a Social Work referral.
